result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles W. McLeod was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

supervisions.notes:
On Count #2, the Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $100 + costs = $579 (includes DNA Surcharge); due in $75 incriments per month, beginning 6/1/2015 and on the 1st day of the month until paid in full. Non-payment results in a 12 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive. 
1 day credit given for time served

with criminal case settlement and elements

Case called at 9:07 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for FSSC)
[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for Branch IV]
Defendant Charles W. McLeod in court with Attorney Yelena Olegovna Zarwell. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On Motion of the State, the Court strikes the domestic abuse allegation on Ct#2

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count#1
Sentencing arguments by Counsel, Statements by Mr. McLeod

On Count #2, the Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $100 + costs = $579 (includes DNA Surcharge); due in $75 incriments per month, beginning 6/1/2015 and on the 1st day of the month until paid in full. Non-payment results in a 12 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive. 
1 day credit given for time served
Recess: 9:25 am
Jury trial on April 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on April 21, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Case called at 8:38 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Charles W. McLeod in court with Attorney Yelena Olegovna Zarwell. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Zarwell requests matter be set for trial
Counsel agree 1 day is needed for trial
Court reminds Mr. McLeod that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect while the case is pending and that the last date to settle case is at the FSSC
Recess: 8:40 am

NEXT: (1) Schedule FSSC 4/21/15 at 9:00 am - Send notices (2) Schedule JT 4/27/15 at 8:30 am - Send notices
Status conference on March 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on February 4, 2015 at 10:20 am.
original bond document received from JESO on 1/14/15

case called at 1:36pm [MK]
Defendant Charles W. McLeod appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Yelena Zarwell (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Pleas of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defense 

The Court requires a $500 signature bond, with conditions:
--Mr. McLeod is to provide his new telephone number, listing it on the Bond form, before release from incarceration
--no contact with Ian Cusick; however the Court specifically authorizes that Mr. McLeod may reside at 411 Converse Street so that if Mr. Cusick comes to that residence, Mr. McLeod may call the police to report that
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to take prescription drugs only as prescribed
--not to engage in any acts or threats of violence 
recess 1:43pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 2/4/15 at 10:20am  (2) Status Conference on 3/3/15 at 8:30am.
